weekByWeekBreakdown.focus: Workouts 4x (20-min bodyweight). Pushups daily (15-20 reps). Running 2x (15-min walk/jog). Track everything.
Increase workout to 25 min. Pushups hit 25-30 reps. Running 3x (20 min continuous). Soreness fading, energy rising.
Workouts feel automatic. Pushups 35-40 reps. Running 3x (25 min). Visible changes, strength gains measurable.

successMetrics: By day 21, you'll have completed 12 workouts, doubled pushup capacity, run 6-9 times, experience measurably higher energy and mood, see visible physical changes, and feel genuine momentum to continue. NooLife 21-day fitness finishers report an average 1.8x strength increase and 94% transition to longer challenges (30-day or 66-day).
commonPitfalls: Going too hard Day 1 (start moderate or Week 2 soreness causes burnout)
Not tracking progress (seeing numbers climb motivates continuation)
Skipping workouts due to soreness (light movement helps recovery)
Comparing to advanced athletes (focus on your own baseline)
Not eating enough (fuel workouts with adequate protein/carbs)
Quitting at Day 14 plateau (gains continue even when newness fades)
